title: Investigation is launched after 11-year-old who called 911 for help is shot by officer in Mississippi
description: An investigation is underway after a police officer in Mississippi shot an 11-year-old boy who called 911 on behalf of his mother during a domestic disturbance.

title: House's most conservative members make new demands of McCarthy
description: House's most conservative members make new demands of McCarthy

title: Indiana doctor who spoke about 10-year-old patient's abortion faces a disciplinary hearing
description: In a hearing, a board may decide whether to penalize Dr. Caitlin Bernard, who spoke publicly about providing an abortion to a 10-year-old rape victim from Ohio.

title: Oath Keepers founder gets 18 years in longest Jan. 6 sentencing
description: Stewart Rhodes, the Oath Keepers founder, sentenced to federal prison in connection with the Jan. 6 attack following his conviction on seditious conspiracy.

title: Brian Laundrie's mother offered him a shovel and garbage bags in 'burn after reading' letter
description: Brian Laundrie’s mother offered him a shovel and garbage bags if he needed to dispose of a body, according to a letter enclosed in an envelope that said “burn after reading,” court filings reveal.

title: Car crashes into Downing Street where U.K. Prime Minister Rishi Sunak lives
description: Armed police on Thursday arrested a man after a vehicle was driven into the gates of Downing Street where Britain's Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and several other senior politicians reside.

title: Military must focus on short- and long-term challenges of climate change, report finds
description: Climate change may imperil the U.S. military's ability to train troops, maintain equipment and facilities and operate effectively both at home and abroad, according to a new report on global warming's effect on national security.

title: Supreme Court rules for Idaho landowners in wetlands dispute
description: The Supreme Court rules that land owned by Idaho couple Chantell and Mike Sackett does not fall under jurisdiction of the Clean Water Act.

title: Online photo scams: How to spot the unexpected dangers
description: Regular people are getting caught up in a catfishing scheme and then paying the price when scammers use their images, names and even their children to steal money from strangers. NBC’s Vicky Nguyen reports for TODAY and shares ways to protect your pics online — including running a reverse image search.

title: NSO spyware used in Armenia-Azerbaijan conflict, report finds
description: Invasive spyware capable of reading a smartphone’s messages and listening to calls was found on the phones of at least 12 Armenian journalists, politicians and civil society members, according to a report published Thursday by a group of nonprofit organizations.

title: As federal officials delayed rules on infant loungers, babies continued to die
description: The Consumer Product Safety Commission recalled Boppy loungers after babies suffocated. But other infant loungers remain for sale, and more babies have died.

title: Chinese hackers are spying on U.S. critical infrastructure, Microsoft and Western intelligence agencies say
description: A state-sponsored Chinese hacking group has been spying on U.S. critical infrastructure organizations, Western intelligence agencies and Microsoft said.

title: What will happen if the U.S. hits the debt ceiling?
description: The U.S. is days away from needing more cash to pay its bills. What steps will Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen likely take to determine who gets paid and when?

title: Ron DeSantis is stuck in the middle and getting punched from above and below
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis entered the race for the 2024 GOP nomination in the No. 2 spot. In a Trump-dominated world, that makes him the prime target.

title: Paralyzed man able to walk again with brain and spine implants
description: For more than a decade, Gert-Jan Oskam has been trying to re-learn to walk again after a motor bike accident in his 20s paralyzed him from the hips down, but with the help of digital implants in his brain and spine, Oskam is back on his feet. NBC News' Josh Lederman reports.

title: Uvalde’s town square is a space for public mourning a year after elementary school massacre
description: Uvalde, Texas' town square became a space for public mourning as families marked the one-year anniversary of the Robb Elementary School shooting.

title: 2024 presidential tracker: See who's in the race and who's on the sidelines
description: Track the 2024 presidential candidates. See who's declared and who is still on the sidelines.

title: With DeSantis event, Twitter solidifies its place in the conservative media world
description: Democratic strategists said the joint Musk-DeSantis event was the latest example of the billionaire aligning himself and Twitter with conservative politics.
